thread.title: Downton Abbey episode 4: Twitter reacts as familiar faces return and innuendos run rampant - Downton Abbey TV
thread.title_full: Downton Abbey episode 4: Twitter reacts as familiar faces return and innuendos run rampant - Downton Abbey News - TV - Digital Spy

author: Megan Davies
title: Downton Abbey episode 4: Twitter reacts as familiar faces return and innuendos run rampant - Downton Abbey TV
text: Following last week's highly-anticipated wedding, the surprise arrival of Allen Leech as Tom Branson and the return of Rose Leslie, this week's episode was overrun with familiar faces - and fans of the show had a lot to say.Between Branson's changing politics and the welcome return of Matthew Goode as one Henry Talbot from last year's Christmas special, Digital Spy turned to Twitter to find out what everyone thought: © ITV / Nick Briggs For some, Tom Branson's return was welcomed whole-heartedly:It's great to have you back @Allenleech ... Now where's that gold envelope #DowntonAbbey— Phillip Schofield (@Schofe) October 11, 2015TOM BRANSON IS BACK #DowntonAbbey— tash (@17blqcknjh) October 11, 2015Oh am so glad Tom's back @DowntonAbbey @ITV @Allenleech #DowntonAbbey— Kirsty Bennett (@KirstyBennett5) October 11, 2015While others weren't quite sold on the character's comeback:Coincidental: Tom has come back fat and also now likes capitalism? #DowntonAbbey— Nicole Caile (@AlmostDaria) October 11, 2015Tom Branson's politics went from revolutionary socialist to Ed Miliband style 'responsible capitalism' in just 3 seasons... #DowntonAbbey— Rayhan Uddin (@Ray_Uddin) October 11, 2015But Tom wasn't the only character making a reappearance on Downton tonight:OH MY GOD GWEN!? #DowntonAbbey— Beccy Ward (@beccyward24) October 11, 2015Watch out for Gwen.... She's a Wildling!!!! #DowntonAbbey— Phillip Schofield (@Schofe) October 11, 2015Gwen: 'You know nothing Thomas Barrow' ...#DowntonAbbey— Martine Alexis (@MartineAlexis) October 11, 2015First Matthew Goode, now Gwen is back championing women's education...this episode is a DREAM #DowntonAbbey— Chiara Ventura (@ColdAsIceCream) October 11, 2015#DowntonAbbey Everything is Matthew Goode and nothing hurts @kopijunkie— aurelie (@lilou82) October 11, 2015Well #Downton just got a lot more interesting (hotter). Hello Matthew Goode— Samantha McKittrick (@samckittrick) October 11, 2015Matthew Goode in Downton. Him and Branson. You're spoiling me— Draculaura (@LauraEms_) October 11, 2015There was some rather scandalous talk about a *ahem* gearstick:Mary needs more than a handsome smile and a hand on the gearstick. #DowntonAbbey— The Dowager Countess (@theLadyGrantham) October 11, 2015Ooer! Gear stick innuendo! #DowntonAbbey— Sarah Wyatt (@seahorsegrl) October 11, 2015" Mary needs more than a handsome smile and a hand on the gear stick" Don't we all? #DowntonAbbey— Judy Reith (@parentingpeople) October 11, 2015Oh dear, was that a double entendre from the Dowager Countess? Gearstick, indeed #DowntonAbbey— Michelle Birkby (@michelleeb) October 11, 2015And while some fans took the opportunity to speculate on which characters may not survive the series:Will Lord Grantham die soon? Not only an ulcer? #DowntonAbbey— Claudia Schmidt (@foolforfood_de) October 11, 2015Lord Grantham's health is a constant worry this season. He better not be the one that dies this season! #DowntonAbbey— Shaunna Smith (@JustShaunnaMS) October 11, 2015The Earl of Grantham is toast. #Downton #DowntonAbbey— Caroline (@caroline_77) October 11, 2015Cora: "Not that pain again?" Robert: "Yes, I'm afraid it seems I'm unlikely to survive this series." #Downton #DowntonAbbey— Jon Reed (@jonreed) October 11, 2015Predicting a very bad future to Robert. I don't think he'll see the end of the season :( #DowntonAbbey— Sra Cheg_TS (@SraCheg_TS) October 11, 2015One fan's thoughts were still firmly with Mr Carson:#Downton #DowntonAbbey #CarsonQuick snap of Carson on his honeymoon @DowntonAbbey @Allenleech @hughbon :) pic.twitter.com/R7edUxXPru— Emma Macdonald (@EmmaMac111) October 11, 2015But the final line of the night has to go to the Dowager Countess herself:Are you here to help or irritate? #DowntonAbbey— The Dowager Countess (@theLadyGrantham) October 11, 2015And we love her all the more for it:"Are you here to help or irritate?" #DowntonAbbey I must remember that line - could use it regularly!— Helen Dixon (@HelenDixon10) October 11, 2015Queen of sass and fabulousness! #DowntonNight #Downton #DowntonAbbey pic.twitter.com/tHmOOMPHA5— Emily (@RigsPeltLove) October 11, 2015Downton Abbey continues this Sunday (October 18) at 9pm on ITV.
